articles.title: Prettier 3.1 Released
articles.description: The popular opinionated code formatter has a new release including support for the new control flow syntax in Angular 17 plus a new, experimental formatting option for ternary expressions (as in x ? y : z) explained in more depth in "A curious case of the ternaries."
articles.author: Alex Rattray

articles.title: Exploring Explicit Resource Management in JS
articles.description: A practical look at the idea of explicit resource management, an idea both currently at stage 3 in TC39 (and partly supported in TypeScript 5.2) that makes it easier to ‚Äòclean up‚Äô resources once they are no longer used or needed.
articles.author: Ilia Pozdnyakov

articles.title: On HTML Web Components
articles.description: ‚ÄúWith web components, you might even say React‚Äôs component model is being ported to the browser. But it‚Äôs being done in a way that works to enhance how the web already works, not replace it‚Äù.
articles.author: Jim Nielsen

articles.title: A Review of Lightweight JavaScript Frameworks
articles.description: This overview is targeted at Django (i.e. Python) developers but if you, too, want to avoid larger frameworks like React or Angular, you might appreciate this look at numerous alternatives from Stimulus and htmx to more oblique options like Laravel Livewire.
articles.author: Michael Yin

articles.title: 67 Browser-Based Debugging Tricks
articles.description: A list of useful, ‚Äònot-obvious‚Äô hacks to get the most out of the browser‚Äôs DevTools. Assumes a reasonable existing understanding of said tools.
articles.author: Alan Norbauer

articles.title: Exploring V8's Strings: Implementation and Optimizations
articles.description: Note: This is very technical and most JavaScript developers do not need to go this deep. That aside, this is a fantastic look under the covers of how the V8 engine handles strings, including the optimizations used that allow it to go toe to toe with languages like C++.
articles.author: Ilia Pozdnyakov

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†An Overview of Angular 17's New Built-In Control Flow
articles.description: Angular 17 was released last week and a significant enhancement was support for a new syntax in templates that looks and feels more JavaScript-y.
articles.author: Dmytro Mezhenskyi

articles.title: Moving Back to React (from Preact)
articles.description: Preact felt like a logical, lightweight choice to this team at one time, but they‚Äôve switched to React for better compatibility with Next.js, among other things. Their page weight is up slightly, but they feel the tradeoff is worth it.
articles.author: Ante Bariƒá (Daily‚Ä§Dev)

articles.title: My Journey to 3x Faster Builds: Trimming Barrel File Imports
articles.description: ‚ÄúI maintain a small frontend application (4K LOC) which uses Vite as the compiler. The production build, using npm run build, was taking 26 secs on Github Actions. It seemed awfully slow for such a small application. I decided to investigate why.‚Äù
articles.author: Ramana Venkata

articles.title: Can Bun Eat Node‚Äôs 'Lunch'?
articles.description: An experiment in migrating a codebase (a restaurant voting app called Lunch) from Node over to Bun and seeing how it fares.
articles.author: Jeffrey Carl Faden

articles.title: How to Use NPM Packages Outside of Node
articles.description: Learn how to run NPM packages in ‚Äòother places‚Äô like serverless platforms, the browser, and beyond.
articles.author: George MacKerron (Neon)

articles.title: gsplat.js: A Gaussian Splatting Library
articles.description: Gaussian splatting is an increasingly popular graphics rendering techniques where rather than render millions of tiny, textured triangles in a scene, you get a more wild paintball-like splatter fest, where each paintball creates a smooth, colorful blob instead of a rigid shape. This demo is both simple and striking.
articles.author: Dylan Ebert

articles.title: Reveal.js 5.0: The HTML Presentation Framework
articles.description: A way to build presentations using standard Web technologies. The project‚Äôs homepage is, itself, such a presentation. v5.0 adds support for ‚Äòscroll mode‚Äô which essentially turns presentations into more typically scrolling Web experiences ‚Äì demo.
articles.author: Hakim El Hattab

articles.title: Datasheet Grid: An Airtable-like React Component
articles.description: If you‚Äôve got an array of objects and you want a way for users to manipulate them, this is for you. It‚Äôs not going to replace a spreadsheet or an extensive data grid framework, but it‚Äôs a mature solution featuring smooth animations, virtualized rows/columns, keyboard navigation, and more.
articles.author: Nicolas Keller

articles.title: Perfect Freehand: A Library for Creating Better 'Freehand' Lines
articles.description: You can try it out here. Makes your e-signature not look like chicken scratch! Might be useful for drawing apps.
articles.author: Steve Ruiz

articles.title: Wild Wild Path v5: Object Property Paths with Wildcards and Regexps
articles.description: A 'wild' way to access properties in objects (which can be deeply nested) by way of string based queries that support wildcards and regexes. The examples help communicate the idea.
articles.author: ehmicky

articles.title: @storybook-test: More Streamlined and Powerful Storybook Testing
articles.description: @storybook/test consolidates the API of @storybook/jest and @storybook/testing-library into a new, single package, powered by Vitest.
articles.author: Kasper Peulen

articles.description: Node.js v21.2.0 (Current)
visx 3.5 ‚Äì D3-based visualization primitives for React.
fx 31.0 ‚Äì Powerful terminal JSON viewer.
Astro 3.5, Ember 5.4, and Prisma 5.6.

articles.title: A Faster Web in 2024
articles.description: The responsiveness metric Google uses in the Core Web Vitals assessment is changing in 2024 (to INP ‚Äì 'Interaction to Next Paint'). Rick outlines how this metric is uncovering issues that have been flying under the radar, and what we‚Äôre going to need to do as a result. There‚Äôs also a ‚ñ∂Ô∏è video presentation for this piece, if you‚Äôd prefer.
articles.author: Rick Viscomi

articles.title: On HTML Web Components
articles.description: ‚ÄúWith web components, you might even say React‚Äôs component model is being ported to the browser. But it‚Äôs being done in a way that works to enhance how the web already works, not replace it‚Äù.
articles.author: Jim Nielsen

articles.title: Designing Web Design Documentation
articles.description: Highlights the importance of good documentation for safeguarding best practices across web design and development. Documentation ‚Äúmust be like its medium ‚Äî interactive and constantly evolving‚Äù.
articles.author: Frederick O'Brien

articles.title: Surprising Facts About New CSS Selectors
articles.description: Scott digs into how the :is() selector and its various, functional pseudo-class siblings :not(), :has(), and :where() work.
articles.author: Scott Vandehey

articles.title: Mastering DOM Manipulation with Plain JavaScript
articles.description: A mega collection of hundreds of examples of doing things like selecting text, manipulating elements, resizing things, scrolling, and such ‚Äì all by using the DOM and browser APIs with no external libraries. You Might Not Need jQuery is another classic resource in a similar vein.
articles.author: Phuoc Nguyen

articles.title: Moving Back to React (from Preact)
articles.description: Preact felt like a logical, lightweight choice to this team at one time, but they‚Äôve switched to React for better compatibility with Next.js, among other things. Their page weight is up slightly, but they feel the tradeoff is worth it.
articles.author: Ante Bariƒá (Daily‚Ä§Dev)

articles.title: Modern Frontend Testing with Vitest, Storybook and Playwright
articles.description: A look at why frontend testing is worth the effort, why it possibly had a bad reputation in the past, and shares an approach to making tests easy to write and maintain.
articles.author: Ian VanSchooten

articles.title: The URL, Explained
articles.description: A quick breakdown of the different parts that make up the URLs we all know and love.
articles.author: IT Tavern

articles.title: Perfect-Freehand
articles.description: Your results may vary here depending on just how good you are at free-handing with a mouse or trackpad (that‚Äôs my shabby attempt above) ‚Äî but this site lets you draw something out, dynamically smoothen it out, alter the result, and export the finished creation as an SVG. Here's the associated repo if you want to integrate the feature into your own apps.
articles.author: Steve Ruiz

articles.title: scroll-timeline: A Polyfill for the Scroll-Driven Animations API
articles.description: More specifically, this covers the ScrollTimeline and ViewTimeline APIs, which are detailed in the spec here, and still currently experimental in terms of browser support.
articles.author: Robert Flack

articles.title: Ribbon Shapes: A Gallery of 100+ Pure CSS¬†Ribbons
articles.description: You certainly won‚Äôt need all of these ‚Äì but there‚Äôs any ribbon style you can imagine here! They‚Äôre quite attractive and easy to copy and paste into your code.
articles.author: Temani Afif

articles.title: HTMLrev: A Directory of Categorized Frontend Templates, Free for Commercial Use
articles.description: The site doesn‚Äôt hold any templates, but merely links to the resources. You can filter by any of the tech categories (HTML, React, Next, Tailwind, etc.) which include landing pages, portfolios, dashboards, etc. Naturally, your mileage may vary.
articles.author: HTMLrev
